alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 19 at 1:44AM PST until January 23 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY MONO COUNTY ABOVE 7500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT FOR MONO COUNTY ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 7500 feet, snow. Snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches, and locally 6 to 12 inches along the Sierra crest. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph, with gusts to 60 mph along the Sierra crest. For the Winter Storm Watch for Mono County above 7000 feet, heavy snow. Snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches along and west of US-395 with 1 to 2 feet near the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the daily commutes through Monday evening.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
